Reviews.Title: Not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: If youre looking for hi tech crystal clear images and detailed images, move on. If you just want a basic, easy to install CCTV system this is great. Its as easy as mount the cameras with 3 screws, plug the cameras into the cables, run the wires to the unit and plug them in. Its easier than the average surround sound system.the night vision is OK, works well in darkness up to about 10 feet; the images are black & white though. The overall image quality is OK, if someone is within about 15 feet the image is clear enough to recognize a stranger by the photo.  Past 30 feet you'd have a hard time distingushing between Jessica Simpson and Hillary Clinton. When you attempt to 'zoom' the image it gets very grainy, so forget that idea. The field of view is fairly narrow, so if you are using it in a small space (10x10 room) the view is limited.Overall, its a breeze to put in and use, just dont expect the best image quality. if youre a small business or a homeowner, its fine though.UPDATE 2/13: here we are less then 18 months later and the system is not working properly. First, one camera developed issues with the image and rolling lines. Then a second camera did the same thing. Now the images freeze on the screen every few minutes for 30-45 seconds and it stops recording while this happens. I tried to contact Zmoto with no luck. For being less then 18 months old and only used inside a climate controlled store, I am disappointed. Pass and pick another better quality setup.

Reviews.Title: ZMODO DVR systems
Reviews.Author: Mech
Reviews.Content: Do your research.  I've seen a lot of bad reviews for Zmodo DVR's on other websites from people that don't know anything about CCTV IR based camera systems...I own 2 of these DVR systems, in my experience they are the best.  For years I struggled with PCI based DVR solutions, (SAMS club specials to) they ALL SUCK.  The software for all PCI based cards is the same Chinese garbage. No support, no updates, short operational life.Out of the box the Zmodo systems work very well and without hassle.  Couple of points to this...#1 Camera quality, for the price you can't expect the best.  The most important feature here is the DVR and these are worth the price (- cameras).  These don't have much range, they are too small you really need to tailor cameras to your environment.  Buy a larger one for distance visibility at night.  Do your research.  You can't expect these to see a license plate 15" away.#2 To improve image quality use coax and not the dual cables provided.  Lot of quality loss in these but it isn't practical for companies to sell these with large coax bundles shipping would eat you.Only complaint I have is the manual is bad engrish.Regarding the actual DVR, it's fairly easy to use, the interface isn't the best but it is better than other systems.  The IE software is like all IE software, its buggy.  This one isn't compatible with mac but you can use vMEye on your iPhone to view it remotely.  There are other options for Mac, I don't ding the DVR for bad third party integration.  DVR should be standalone and work on its own anyway.  The newer model is mac compatible.  As for upgrades, there are non, but its pretty rock solid as is.  Would be nice to be able to shell into it to play with the linux build on it.  Again I wouldn't ding this product for the lack of upgrades when you compare it to the rest of the low end DVR market.Lastly support.  I had some issues with the last one I ordered missing parts and having a mixing issue (maybe woot issue).  The support was very surprising.  I hadn't needed it before.  Make sure you call the US support, don't email or use web chat it goes to China.

Reviews.Title: For the price paid.....THIS UNIT IS WORTH EVERY PENNY!!!
Reviews.Author: JosephN
Reviews.Content: This system packs a massive load of value for the price paid. If you're looking for a basic camera system with decent camera images, then this is what you're looking for. By no means is it a commercial level feature packed system that can produce "High Definition Images". It cannot see fine detail, but produces usable images to see mischef around your property or business. For example, if you want to know which neighbor is messing with your car or who's dog took a crap on your lawn, you can probably identify someone you've seen before. The closer you can get a subject to these cameras the more detail you can see.INITIAL IMPRESSIONS:The DVR looked exactly as I intended. It was a good size and included a Western Digital 500GB Green Drive with a very recent manufacturing date. The cameras were smaller than I thought. No problem with that. All metal construction. Looked perfect for my installation. Everything was packed well in China!!INSTALLATION:I had already wired up my house with Siamese RG59/power cabling. I used no crimp BNC connectors and cut off the power plugs that were on the supplied bundles of camera cables. I spliced the plugs to the power cabling at the camera end and DVR. (Note: I used crimp caps with a little corrosion compound for the connections outside) If you're going to do this make sure you dont damage the conductors while stripping. Use the proper strippers and crimpers!!  The supplied power wire is very delicate (looked like 30awg wire). I mounted the cameras on the underside of my roof soffits. I won't get into much detail on that. Every application is different. I can say the supplied brackets worked out well. I had to mess with the cheap ball socket to get the camera to hold the position I wanted.  I'll try to post a picture of how I mounted them.POWER UP:I had everything connected including an old CRT monitor I had laying around. Everything worked and I was up and running with images on my screen. I adjusted all the cameras. A lot of back and forth, up and down. I got a workout. I started clicking around the menus. I've never used any other CCTV DVR before but I found no problems figuring out the menus. The included instructions were not that great. I just used them for reference. If you struggle with any type of menu system, you're probably have difficulty. I use all different types of menu structures for the type of work I do so I didn't have any trouble. I found it very intuitive.NETWORK SETUP:I am not a network setup expert. If you know nothing about networks, have someone else set it up for you. The instructions are not very good for someone who doesn't know what an IP address is. Once I figured out what IP address my router gave to the DVR I was up and running on another networked PC in my home. It did take a little tweaking of the settings within Internet Explorer to get it to work. Make sure it prompts you for unsigned Active X. The Zmodo website has information on this. There are also videos on youtube on this subject. For some reason, it only works on IE. I can't get access on Firefox, Opera, or any wireless device in my home. I need to consult with someone else on that. My router also opened up the ports I needed automatically because it had that feature. There is a setting in the DVR that you need to enable for that to work. I did get remote access on my Android phone with the IP Cam app. You need to know what INTERNET IP address you are by going to whatismyip or log into your router. Because I don't have a static IP, I need to use the DNS Service suggested in the information supplied. I won't go into this. It's too complicated and like I said, I'm not an expert. I can figure it out but can't explain it very well. I know it will work once I get it all set up.OTHER COMMENTS:I setup basic stuff like time/date, recording, motion, without issue. It may take a little messing with different settings to figure out how it all works. I'm very happy with the features of this DVR. I like how you can search for specific camera recording with motion marks. This way you don't need to watch hours of video. You can go right to where it saw motion. You can fast forward or manually go back. I've read other reviews of comparable DVR's in which you can't do that. A definite plus!! I'm still discovering other features the more I mess with it. Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase. Amazon currently has the best price. It was delivered without issue as usual.***If you're not interested in remote access or home network access, this system will still work great. You can view everything from a monitor connected to the DVR and use the included laser mouse. You'll be up and running and love it!!I hope this in depth review helps others decide what system to buy.

Reviews.Title: Be warned - remote feature is very hard to set up!
Reviews.Author: Adriana
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a basic surveillance system, this one will do just fine. The picture is OK, not crystal clear but good enough. I love the motion detection, night vision, and snap shots via email that you can set to receive in 1-10 min intervals. As to the installation ... If you have no IT background, you can probably still get through the basic installation fine. However, if you are going to try to set up the remote viewing feature, be warned that the instructions are not clear, and the pictures included with the instructions are not readable at all. Yes, you can call the tech support, but prepare for a LONG hold (and only during business hours - no weekends, no evenings). I was on hold for 67 minutes and spent another 1.5 hrs on the phone with the tech who helped me with the remote and iPhone set up. I thought to myself: this is a person who does it for a living, and it took him 1.5 hrs to set it up, how is someone like me without any IT background supposed to do that? The tech I spoke to admitted that the instructions are written very poorly and impossible to understand for a layperson. The set up still has some glitches even after the tech call, so I need to call again and go through another waste of a couple hours, but at least all the basics are installed now. So, if you have IT knowledge (or know someone who does) or a lot of patience and time, you should be ok. Otherwise, this will likely be a very frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: Beats anything at Sam's or Costco. Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Charles B. Firth "Chuck"
Reviews.Content: I have looked at the 4 channel security systems at Sam's club for years. For $219.27 with free Prime shipping and no sales tax, this just cannot be beat. I should add that I did not receive the DVR in the listing, PKD-DK4216. Instead they sent me what must be a newer model, the H9114V. It is much cooler looking and does not have any front panel controls, just a clean shiny black panel. The features are accessed using the remote or using the included optical mouse, both work great. Very sleek looking. Note: It is smaller than the photo makes it look as well, not VCR sized as expected, but only about 11" wide and 1 12" tall.This thing has a 500 gig Western Digital hard drive pre-instaled in it. That used to be an $80 value on its own. All I had to do was connect cameras and plug it into power and a VGA monitor to make it work. I also changed the default password. All cameras work great, not HD, but I think the images are very good. (I was used to a cheap wireless camera system I had before which was very grainy.) My property is pitch black at night, so the night view is fairly limited with just a spot on the ground and some tree branches visible. A person would have to walk right up to the camera and look at it to be seen with any detail. But if we had street lights or security lights I am sure it would be much better. Daylight is great.So, I connected the cameras, mouse, monitor, power and turned it on and up popped four images. Nice. Then I took it all apart and started routing the cables. A half inch or smaller boring bit is all you need if you are going through walls like I did, since you can fish the power and video connectors through the hole individually.The cables are way longer than I needed since I was just putting this in a 20x20 outbuilding. Lots of extra cable.So I got it all installed and then I hooked up the Ethernet cable... Ahhhh... sweet. Note: I am configured through a Ethernet switch (actually a wireless access point which also has wired ports) which connects to my wired router (Netgear dual with wireless turned off). You do not need to be connected directly to a router port, you can go through a switch. I tried looking at the manual to do the configuration and got bored with that and just found myself going out to Google. That is how I found the Zmodo knowledge-base. [...]I was able to find out everything I needed at the above web site. I was able to get all the correct network settings installed by starting with this page: [...] That told me how to get the default settings via DHCP. Later you need to change this to Static as per the instructions (adding 20 to the last two IP digits, in my case 25 + 20 = 45). Be sure to read all the sublinks about setting up IE with the correct Activex settings, setting up port forwarding in your router (they even had screen shots of all the most popular router setup software, including my own) and use the port checker link to check the port settings and get the external address as well, Port checker here: [...] Remote settings: [...]Then I found another page for the iPhone: [...]Note: I am NOT a network expert. In fact, I am pretty illiterate about network stuff. I just searched and followed directions. I am however very computer literate (used to the jargon) and that helped me fill in some blanks which might have confused, say, my wife.Now I can remote view all four cameras from either my PC via IE or on my iPhone. The iPhone app Zviewer is awesome. It even works over ATT 4G. I am leaving on a vacation next week and it will be very cool to pull out my phone and see four realtime views of my property from 1000 miles away -- and without dealing with messy web cam stuff and Windows/PC software. And don't forget... this thing is recording the video as well. You can rewind and see what has happened in the past as well. it's stand alone. In fact, the unit comes with a computer CD and I have no idea what it is for. I think it is for backing up settings or something to your PC via the unit's USB port.I can't wait to dig into some of the more esoteric features of the DVR setup software -- maybe get a motorized camera, mess with the motion detection...there is a lot of stuff in this thing. ALL for $219.27 flat. Awesome! Very happy so far. And check out Youtube for a video overview:[...]

Reviews.Title: Terrible, Look for something else
Reviews.Author: RichardL
Reviews.Content: My car was keyed about a month ago and I was looking for a good surveillance product to prevent the vandalism from happening again. After doing research for a couple of hours and reading reviews, I thought this would be a good product to go with.When I had first opened this product, I was skeptical because some pieces had been missing. For example you are not given a VGA cable even though it requires VGA output to display the channels. There are no screws provided to mount the camera's while they decided to give you the plates to attach the cameras to. Furthermore upon hooking up the camera I had noticed that one was not functioning. This was already a bad start as not only did the company who made this decide to be cheap and not give you the VGA cable, but one of the 4 cameras was already faulty. Needless to say I decided to keep on setting up giving the product a chance.I am disappointing to say that the night vision on the camera is horrible as you cannot see a single thing in the dark. The field of vision is extremely limited and small meaning that if you are expecting to see the front of your residence it will require all four cameras positioned very far back. Let's just say you won't be able to even recognize who is walking around if they decide to vandalize something. Not only that but the camera's would turn on and off by itself from time to time when recording. I found this out when I was reviewing the video log.The menu's for the device are really slow and the playback settings are even worse because the fastest setting you can set for the playback is 16x. This entails to fast forwarding half a minute a second which means if you are attempting to review 1-3 hour videos you will be there for a very long time. Honestly browsing the menus are extremely frustrating because it feels like running today's applications on a Pentium 1.When it came time to put this product to good use it failed me as my car was vandalized a second time two weeks later. At the most crucial moment when I needed the surveillance most, the camera's turned on and off throughout the night. There is no way that they were disconnected as they were hidden on the roof of the home. The night vision didn't help because it doesn't actually work (You can't see anything let alone recognize anything).Needless to say, save your hard earned money and find a different surveillance product.Had this product actually worked, I would have been able to catch the culprit who vandalized my vehicle but unfortunately not only did it fail but it costed me dearly.I will never buy from Zmodo ever again and would suggest everyone who reads this to stay away.Very disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: Sorry company to deal with
Reviews.Author: ErnestJ
Reviews.Content: I bought the this Zmodo system several weeks ago. When the system arrived I had a letter in the box saying that the cameras that were part of the system were on back order so Zmodo took it upon themselves to send me subsitute camers of a lesser quality. They state they were giving me heavier cables to make up for the subsitution. I contacted them and told them I wanted the cameras that was to be included with the system since they had a higher resolution. I was told that those cameras had come in and would be sent to me once I return the other cameras. I sent the other cameras back and then received an email from Zmodo had decided to give me a refund instead of the proper cameras. So now I have a Zmodo DVR without cameras. Update. With the help of Amazon's great service dept. the right cameras were sent to me. I give Zmodo one star and Amazon 5 stars for making things right.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo 4 camera with DVR works as promised
Reviews.Author: Dave P
Reviews.Content: Review of Zmodo PKD-DK4216-500GB H.264 Internet & 3G Phone Accessible 4-Channel DVR with 4 Night Vision Cameras and 500 GB HD.System arrived quickly and works as advertised.  Overall, I am very happy with the purchase, especially considering the price.  The cameras work great in color or black & white night vision.  The resolution is fine to recognize someone within 20 feet or so.  It would be hard to recognize the face from farther away, but for this price camera system you can't expect that.  As other reviewers suggest, you could just buy a higher resolution camera for 1 or more channels if needed.  Also as others noted, the camera mounts are cheaply made and the weakest link.  However, I got them all to work by loosening them and then quickly tightening them after I had them aimed correctly.  It looks like they use a standard screw base, so you could just purchase better mounts somewhere.The software that comes with the DVR is much more powerful and with more options than I suspected from reading the other reviews.  The interface is a bit clunky to navigate and the documentation is very poor, but I was able to figure it out fairly easily just by going through the various software menus. One nice feature is that you can point and click on a transparent, square block interface which is overlaid on the image projected by each camera.  By selecting individual squares you can mask out portions on a camera's field of view that you don't want the system to detect motion in.  This was very helpful for a camera in our kids room, where we wanted the motion detection triggered if anyone enters or leaves the room, but not if the kids move around in their beds. I just masked out the field of view covering the beds.I recommend this system to anyone looking for a cost effective, basic system with lots of features.

Reviews.Title: Save your money for a better system.  You get what you pay for, and less when you have to get refund minus shipping!!!
Reviews.Author: RL.Robertson
Reviews.Content: After reading the prior reviews, I did expect a very basic simple entry level home surveillance system.  I expected it to have minimal options, low resolution etc.  I read a few other negative reviews, but figured I would take my chances.It was not terribly easy to setup, but it was possible.  I was not pleased with the cameras.  They do not run the cable through the base, but you have to mount the camera to your house, and drill a separate hole to run the cables.  Somebody can literally walk up behind your camera and unplug it.  The screws were also really cheap and strip out very easily.  As for networking, I have basic IT knowledge.  I had a relative help with the mobile surveillance setup (this is the most difficult part).  After setup though, I do expect a product to work properly.  This system FAILED miserably!  The grass is reddish/pink, the reds are green, the colors are all messed up!  I plugged in another camera from a different manufacturer, to find that the colors were true, and it was the cameras themselves rather than the DV-R unit.  Even adjusting the color settings just made other colors off, even when I was able to make the grass appear as green.  I was also having trouble with the remote monitoring.  So that's when tech support came in...  It took me less than 5 minutes to get through to someone, and they spoke great English!According to their rep, the color problem on the cameras is a "known problem with no solution".  He explained they are cheap cameras, and I would need to upgrade them in order to correct thisissue.  He also had me download another app (KMeye) in the android market for remote viewing(using HTC Evo 4g).. This did not correct the problem.  Seems that only channel 1 will update on the mobile app.  So knowing now that this is such a low quality product, I am thankful Amazon has a great return policy.  I'm only out a little for shipping.  I payed the extra cash, and went with the Costco system for 299.  Well worth the extra money.  8 channels, better interface, and much better cameras!  I tried to cheap out, but it came back and bit me.  Seriously seriously consider going with a higher quality system.  The money saved is not worth the hassle and headaches.

Reviews.Title: Updated: Bumpy start, now smooth sailing.
Reviews.Author: MsUhler
Reviews.Content: First Review: We got the first one two weeks ago - easy install on all the cameras.  However, the equipment would not record and one of the cables was defective.  We returned the original unit and received a new unit and connected the hard drive and the additional and everything worked for two minutes.  Then there was hard disk errors.  The manual has NO support number and there is no support or phone number on the unit to look for support.Update:  We did manage to find support information and the staff on the support call were extremely helpful.  Turned out one of our settings was slightly off but the hard drive was not defective.  Three months in and I couldn't be happier with the system.

Reviews.Title: Look At The Pretty Colors. Then look at the blank screen
Reviews.Author: J R M "lmmajm26"
Reviews.Content: Nice system for the price. Shipped on time. The directions are a joke when it comes to setting all of your recording options. Have access to google when setting up so you can look up what all the abreviations mean. Color of cars will show correctly. Leaves, cloths and grass usually show up as PINK to PURPLE. The shady sales ad on Amazon deffinetly did not mention this and there is no monitor in the world that can adjust the color to look normal. If you can live with pink trees, then this is still a good set up for the money. Comes complete, just add monitor or tv and your set.  ............................................................................................................................................................................UPDATE: As of January I have already had to pay an electronics shop to repair the unit once in December. Now a few weeks later this piece of junk crapped out again. I took it apart and with my general knowledge of electronics I can see that having it repaired again would be pointless. All of the componants are barely soldered to the board. They didnt fill the entore hole on the board with solder when assembling, this is probably why it will randomly fail. Its very poor construction and even having my unit safely mounted to where it doesnt get bumped and it gets plenty of air so as not to overheat, it still died twice. Long story short, Hong Kong piece of crap do not buy unless you want a two hundred dollar paper weight.

Reviews.Title: Cautiously Optimistic.
Reviews.Author: T. PATTERSON
Reviews.Content: After reading the good and the bad reviews on this, I bit the bullet and ordered one for our community clubhouse.  I've had experience with a couple of "$700+ DVR" analog systems and the medium spectrum, but not this low end realm.Unboxing - The shipping box arrived in good shape from Amazon.  The inside product box was sealed.  However, the DVR was not well protected inside its box.  There wasn't any protective wrap on it and it was free to bounce around a couple of inches.  There was one missing screw on the back of the cover.  My guess is that it was taken out to have the hard drive installed at a second location.  It was sloppy packaging.  There was also a remote control and CD/literature/power supply under the cardboard platform.  These were fine.The cameras, cables and camera power adapter were in a 2nd box within the product box.  They were OK.Cameras - They are small, almost palm sized.  The mounts are very weak, but do the job.  They can be easily ripped off a wall or tampered with, so mount them where they are hard to get.  All that said, the images are very good.  Not terribly wide angle, so keep that in mind,  The IRs (infrared emitters) work, but don't have much dispersion.  They cameras work very well in medium to low light, before the IRs turn on.  The colors on these were accurate.Cables - 60 feet each.  They are low end, but work.  Be wary of placing them near other electrical wires/devices as they can pick up interference.DVR - Overall good.  The recording quality (set at high) is on par with much more expensive units.  The interface is a bit clunky for my tastes, but does the job - read the manual, you'll need it.  Some things (like the motion detection grid) work opposite the way you'd think it would.  Where you set the blue blocking squares is where it records.  It's counter-intuitive to me and opposite of most higher end systems.  You have some control over image brightness and color, but this one works fine as-is.  The motion detection is decent, but I had to choose low sensitivity on the outdoor cameras.  The H.264 compression is good with small file sizes.  File exporting to thumb drive works, but be sure to have their player software installed on the PC you play it on,  I'm not sure why their version of H.264 is different from everything else.  Still, it works.  I'll try their export to AVI later.  I'm sure it's a weird codec, too.  I have yet to have an internet connection at the clubhouse, so I can't speak to that - yet.Summary - Would I buy this again?  Yes.  For under $200 with installed HD, it's a great little unit.  It's probably not a long-distance runner, but who knows.  If you are smart about placing your cameras, it should work just fine.  If you place them high and 20 feet away, you will be disappointed.  Keep them relatively low and near the area you're watching - if possible.  Analog SD video is what it is.  Even if the cameras get damaged or tampered with, they are cheapies.  You'll should have a recording of who did it anyway.

Reviews.Content: This product is very good for the price.Night vision really works,just not far away.Dvr is very complicating to set up through network.Port forwarding and stuff with your router.if your computer skills are not that great,you'll need someone to set it up for you.I had to hire an IT guy. Reviews.Content: Great value. Fast delivery. Quality picture. Very easy to install.The only issue I have had is two of the cams have collected moisture during heavy rain. It was easliy fixed by placing the cams under the roof drip edge more.

Reviews.Title: This Recorder Cost us over $5,000.00
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Inverso
Reviews.Content: We purchased this Camera/DVR package primarily because it had network/remote viewing capability.  This did not end up being the case at all.You are supposed to be able to view your camera's through a internet browser.  That did not end up being an option because none of the browsers support it any longer.I then tried to install the Zmodo software that came with the package.  The Zmodo disk (not a re-written disk, it is the actual software from Zmodo) has a self replicating virus in it.  This virus got through our companies anti virus software spread to our network and onto a couple of our servers which do not have antivirus for compatibility reasons.We have had to call on our IT company in to rebuild each of these servers which included our Point of Sales Server.  This is going to end up costing us 5 to 8 thousand dollars.  I would be happy to send screenshots, IT bills and the Hardware/software back.Amazon,  PLEASE let me know what your policy is on something like this.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: what they dont tell u
Reviews.Author: t
Reviews.Content: first thing: it does work.  doesnt show great at night in darkness but if you have a light it shows better. i have a motion light so if it comes on. i can see you clearly.  now if you like to upgrade to newest technology like an all in one computer you wont be able to set it up.  you will have to get a different monitor for the set up purposes.  i had zmodo tech support set mine up. the netviewer software being put on your desktop is better than the internet web address. so you dont look for tech support number i will give it to you 18665516881 just call and let them do it. its much better that way.  if one camera stop showing check the back of dvr camera inputs. unplug and replug. mine lost connection for some reason. i swapped the cables around. but all in all it is a good system and works quite well. this is worth the money b/c i could find just a dvr with hard drive for under the price of this. i paid $199 for it.***update**for some reason 2 of the cameras got water behind the lens. they are not working properly.  i will see if i can put a different camera in their place.

Reviews.Title: You're getting a $200, four camera security system. Set expectations accordingly.
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: My background: I'm a geek. I work for software companies writing user documentation. I'm paid to figure things out and then find a simple way to explain them so other people can use them without really having to figure them out. I have no tech aversion whatsoever. I like a challenge. I'm not only comfortable setting up my home network, I've written User Guides for others to do so.Here's what you're getting: a $200 DVR with an operating system and 4 cameras.What that means:It's cheap. Everything's plastic. The components are likely bottom of the ladder garbage. The DVR and remote don't weigh .5LB combined.It's made in China.It's poorly documented. Like, Mad-Libs bad.The operating system/menu functions/on-screen navigation are vague and confusing.Want to manage this from your PC or view it on your iPhone/iPad? You better know what you're doing when it comes to your router configuration.Help and support is understaffed and sometimes conflicting information is scattered all over the place.My story:I took a chance on this. I hooked it up and configured. All was well for about 10 days (never did get the iPhone/iPad thing working, but I was going to revisit that when I had more time). Then, the DVR started beeping incessantly (which started in the middle of the night, as these things inevitably do). The cause was a hard disk error (uh oh). I rebooted. I power cycled. I tried reformatting the hard disk twice. No luck.I went to the Zmodo website and used the "Call me" link for Tech Support to call me when they were available. I was quoted a 95 minute response time. 285 minutes later, my phone rang. The agent suggested I tried reformatting. When I told him I'd done that twice, he had me pull the voltage specs from the power adapter. According to the agent, the power adapter that I have (the one that ships with the product) is insufficient to provide ample power to the DVR to allow it to complete the reformatting process. They're sending me a different power adaptor.Now I enter their RMA queue and we'll see where that goes.So, back to my original point. A high-quality, four camera system is going to run you $1200, minimum. This costs $200. From the materials, to the specs, to the usability, to the documentation, to the support - it's NOT high quality in any way.I'll post an update after I run the RMA gauntlet. This is what you get for $200. Maybe the power adaptor is all I need. I hope so. BUT IF YOU BUY THIS, BE PREPARED FOR A BUMPY RIDE.

Reviews.Title: Unreliable, not recommended
Reviews.Author: Bdalto
Reviews.Content: Bought it about 8 months ago and in the first four months worked fine, then inexplicably stopped recording. Of course I needed to replay an event and nothing there. I reset it. It seemed to be working then when I need to review another event, nothing recorded. Called tech support 58 minute wait. I have 3 dvr's and with all of them you cannot rely on them to have a recording of the event you need when you need it. You must check the dvr on a minimum weekly schedule and you cannot rely on it to record the events when you need them. Hit or miss but this is definetely the worst model of the 3 dvr's I own. Also the backup on this dvr is nonexistent so if you need to save recordings you need a different type.

Reviews.Title: Requires patience
Reviews.Author: Buzzkill "electronics nerd"
Reviews.Content: As far as I can tell this system is a bargain but the main problem with it is that out of the box the advanced settings are confusing and poorly documented. But otherwise it mostly seems to work. How long it lasts is another issue.If all you are interested in i being able to record video then it's pretty easy to setup. If you want to beable view and control the system remotely using an iphone or a remote computer it will take some effort.The first thing you'll want to do is to update the firmware. Download the file to a USB thumbdrive and insert the drive in the front USB port and install it from the Maintenance panel.[...]To use an cellphone download the zviewer App [...]Note that to connect to the DVR video server from your cell phone that the port is 7050 (mobile), 5050 for windows.If you want to connect to the server when you are away from home you will have to setup your home router's NAT (network address translation) to direct traffic to the correct ip and port. It appears that by default the DVR will default to DHCP but you'll want to change it to a static IP in order to use the NAT.Apparently you can only use Internet Explorer on windows to view the DVR and you need to change the Active X security settings in order for it to install it's app. Follow these instructions [...]Here's a list of which ZMODO dvr's work with a mac[...]If you want Email alerts you will need to setup a SMTP server account. Here's some instructions:[...]Also remember that the username and password is case sensitive.There is also another settings in NET for IP that needs to be set to "disabled".. it's a bit counter intuitiveAfter using this system a bit more a few other things worth mentioning is that I have not been able to save video from the interface in Internet Explorer. It appears to do something but then there is no file.I have not been to quite figure out how to save videos directly from the DVR to a usb drive yet either.It's also worth noting that this device appears to only record at 320x240.Again despite these issues it's a fairly good deal for what it is.

Reviews.Title: Nice for an entry level system.
Reviews.Author: J. Gehrman "FatTire"
Reviews.Content: I installed this system on my in-laws place.  The cameras are small but have pretty good vision.  The night vision works but don't expect anything above 20'.  The DVR was easy to setup and get everything going.  I still need to work on getting it available on the network.My in-laws are very impressed and can now view everything going on outside the house from the comfort of their livingroom.  Just remember to purchase a VGA cable so you can plug it into your flat screen TV when you purchase the system.  It's also not a bad idea to get a few extra cables.  The ones that came with mine were 60' which was adequate for 3 of the 4 cameras I installed.

Reviews.Title: not very good at night
Reviews.Author: Robert Pritchard
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit for nighi vision and it did not do the job you need a light on to see well enough to identify the subjectbought it to protect my car and home I guess for the price I can not expect much

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy This Product
Reviews.Author: lilian
Reviews.Content: The day i received it, it stopped working, it just worked like 20 minutes, if i could i return it, but the problem is that i live in Ecuador, and i bring it with a courier service. Please don't buy this, it's the worst DVR ever built.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Bernardus F van Rijn
Reviews.Content: Put system together and it did not work. I have installed two large systems in the past so I know how to do this. I strongly suspected the power supply/transformer for the cameras did not work so I tried to contact the company via live chat on a Friday. After waiting 1/2 hour I was kicked out of the system and asked to try later. Tried later, no response. Left and email later on Friday - no response. Called the following Monday and left on hold for 1/2 hour (luckily, I have a speaker phone). After the 1/2 hour wait I was told to try back later. Left another email - no response. Just for fun I tried live chat again on  Wednesday - no response. Absolutely no customer service. Sending unit back. Try a different brand, the company and equipment are worthless.

Reviews.Title: software doesnt work
Reviews.Author: jose m blanc
Reviews.Content: software doesnt work. i downloaded several times and dindt work. instructions are not clear. i wonder whether all those other super positive reviews are fake by manufacturer

Reviews.Title: The DVR will not communicate with any device including it's own buttons, the TV screen or it's own remote,
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Bourgeois
Reviews.Content: The DVR doesn't work. The remote doesn't work. The DVR won't connect, it warms up then beeps and that's it. Even the buttons on the front don't work. This is the second time I tried to connect to the DVR.

Reviews.Title: Price isnt everything
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The zmodo is great when you get it running. The problem starts later. The color of the cameras go bad or the system degrades quickly.Next time I'd pay more for quality.

Reviews.Title: not very happy.
Reviews.Author: macon2020
Reviews.Content: Both dvrs that we have purchased from this person have gone bad. I would like my money back ..  I should have two dvrs go bad in a one week period.  I want someone to fix this issue.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product and a good price!
Reviews.Author: alfonso bello consuegra
Reviews.Content: The product came to me well and on time, without any problem, I'm already using and it works perfectly, totally recommend.

Reviews.Title: Low quality
Reviews.Author: Ryan Majors
Reviews.Content: Low quality. Small picture. But, what can you expect for something priced this cheap? Wouldn't buy again, rather save up and buy a better quality system.

Reviews.Title: Great Cheap Security System
Reviews.Author: Timothy Foust
Reviews.Content: If you want something that is inexpensive and to keep an eye for movement, this is ideal. It doesn't have the resolution to see a license plate at 100 yards but for general movement, day or night, its great. I have used it for a week to keep an eye out over the parking lot and the yard around my house. During the day I can make out a human form over 500 yards away, I see colors of cars and trucks at the same distance. Night time in a well lit parking lot I can see human forms at 300 yards but since it changes to black and white I can tell the difference between car and truck. In straight dark, I can only see about 10 yards as that is the distance of the infrared bulbs but those that are mounted close to the doors it sees just fine. With a little fiddling you can use the remote systems by just typing in the IP address in the address bar. I installed TeamViewer and can see my video on my Windows 8 phone, it will have about a 3 second delay doing this but since there is no app for Windows 8 phone yet, it works just fine. On my android tablet I have an app, so I share my internet from my Windows 8 phone and can see it that way as well. Later I will get a motorized camera to go with this system and see how I can control it then. Over all its easy and quick to install, minimal requirements and your on the net. Out of the box everything is included for at least a 60ft run, anything over that you will have to buy little things, like adapter to change RCA plug for power feed to two wire adapter and Coaxial cable adapters so you can put ends on bulk coax wire.

Reviews.Title: Great during the day
Reviews.Author: Mary R.
Reviews.Content: The cameras work great during the day. Any ambient light at night causes issues and the picture isn't very clear at night. But it does the job it's designed to do well.

Reviews.Title: This is only the four where is the box to hook them upto??
Reviews.Author: Renee
Reviews.Content: What kind of crap is this nobody said u had to buy the box seperate . Why show this with the box and not mention its not included ? How am I supose to hook these camera's up my t.v does not have these kind of connects . I am very unhappy.

Reviews.Title: couldn't ask for more for the price.
Reviews.Author: Brian Litch
Reviews.Content: This product works well for the low cost. Not a high end system, but for this price I couldnt ask for more. There are several good features, and it does well. The more open the area and the higher the camera the better view. For people on a budget wanting cameras I would recomend. I bought larger gage cables and longer. The cables it comes with are a bit touchy and that was the worst part. Installation was easy to me, but I am an IT consultant, and it may be confusing for technically challenged people.

Reviews.Title: Great!  Its a much better system than I expected, especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: The camera quality was much better than expected!!  I was expecting grainy pictures and figured as long as they are "OK" then I will be happy.  I am much very happy with the system and quality of everything.  The system is very user friendly and easy to operate, getting the network up and running isn't difficult if you are computer savvy.  Overall for less than $200 I have a great system that I can see anywhere, and its one more deterrent for thieves or vandals.I included pictures so you can see the quality, I have two of them run with 100ft wires with no quality loss and these pictures are on my 55" tv so you can really see how good this system is.  Hopefully this helps you guys out

Reviews.Title: Good product for basic
Reviews.Author: Richard Peterson
Reviews.Content: Camera system was easy to install and recorder pick up cameras as they were installed. Picture quality is a little grainy but does have good night vision as long as there is some light source. I have motion detector lights and when triggered camera showed as far as the light went. 60' cables are OK but quality is most likely part of grainy feed.Instruction book is not the best written book but overall helps to get what you need.

Reviews.Title: Good option for the price
Reviews.Author: Alonso Montoya Guzman "Memo"
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something not so expensive, but that gives you some peace of watch over your house, this is a great option.The system is easy to install, just plug the adapters, place the cameras and connect them to the DVR.Menus and settings are intuitive, and most configurations doesn't need to be changed.The camera quality is good in daylight, in the night it's not so good. This is the reason to give 4 stars, the night vision capabilities of the cameras should be better, but for the price is acceptable. If you have a light near the camera, the video quality increases so much, but it total darkness is poor.Programmed mine to record with motion detection and works perfectly.Maybe the most difficult part to configure is the remote view over the internet. But it's not because of the DVR, but for the reason that if you use DHCP within your home network and your public IP address is not fixed, you need to do some changes in your wireless network configuration, and you need to know your public IP address if you want to access remotely to the DVR. But, if you have basic network configuration knowledge, this shouldn't take more than 15 minutes.Very happy with this product so far.

Reviews.Title: good product, but confusing
Reviews.Author: Brandon S.
Reviews.Content: The overall product is great. The camera quality is good along with picture quality. The only bad thing is it's very difficult to set it up to work on internet and phone. I have had it for about a month now and still haven't been able to get it to work.

Reviews.Title: Okay DVR, ABYSMAL Tech Support
Reviews.Author: R. Miller
Reviews.Content: As valued-priced DVR systems go, the Zmodo system isn't bad.  The hard disk provides ample storage room for 4 channels at the highest resolution, and the equipment is easy to set-up and install.  The problem is that the remote viewing feature is insanely difficult to install, even for those of us with decent technical aptitude.  I have followed every instruction to a T, even the updated ones on their website, and after a combined 8 hours of toil, I have not been able to get the remote viewing capability to work.After seeing that Zmodo's website now offers technical support options, I called their Tech Support line.  The first time, I was #10 in the queue and did not have time to wait, so decided to call back.  I was also logged on to their "live" online tech support at that time and was not able to get a hold of anyone.  Today, after again following their instructions and again failing to get the mobile viewing to work, I called again.  I was then #7 in line and went online to try their "live" tech support while on hold.  Again, I was unable to contact anyone online and was sent to a general email box.  To boot, after 30 minutes on hold and only making it up to #5 in queue, I was suddenly disconnected by Zmodo.  When I called back, I got a voicemail stating that their Tech Support staff was in a monthly meeting and to leave a message.So, now, after 5 attempts at contacting them and nearly 9 hours of trying to get this piece of junk to work, I'm back at square one with no real hope of a resolution.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product a few days ago and set it up right away after hearing some of the reviews which indicated they received broken units.I am pleased to say mine arrived intact and works great.  I think the other reviews have been accurate.  The system as a whole is great for the $200 I payed for it.  Night vision camera are only good for about 10 feet.  Fine for indoors or aiming at your front door to see who is there, but dont expect to see your entire backyard at night.In Daylight, the cameras have a decent resolution.  Could be better quality, but still better than what I expected for this price.  The colors are WAY off.  Black looks purple and Blue looks purple.  The colors are inaccurate.I setup my iPhone, iPad, and my Mac to see the video streams.  I had no problem making this all work, however, I am a Network Engineer.  For someone with no experience in networking, it could seem rather difficult.For the $200 I payed for it, I am extremely pleased.  It's not the quality I would have liked it to be, but to get 4 IP connected cameras and a device to record would have been well over $3500.  While the quality of the video is way lower than the $3500 system would have been, I can still make out who was in my yard and at what time which is my primary need for this.I would recommend this product if you are looking for a decent system with less than a $500 budget.

Reviews.Title: Totally Misleading
Reviews.Author: Don Walls
Reviews.Content: 1.Directions are not for the average layman, very confusing. 2. Every online site that's supposed to give you info seems to be non-existant .3. the DVR only records for 24 hours then resets. 4. the cameras lack any kind of detail such as not being able to read a license plate at 20 feet away. 5. the wiring is super cheap and very fragile making it a nightmare to go through a single day without having to wiggle conections or replace to get things working right. ETC...

Reviews.Title: Easy set-up
Reviews.Author: Joseph E. Repasky
Reviews.Content: It's a good little unit.  Second one I've bought similar to this, but first with motion detection.DEFINITELY set the schedule.  The family I installed this for wanted cameras around the house where they walk all the time or have ceiling fans running.  the hard drive was full in three weeks.The online set-up was a challenge.  the zmodo.com/network page was only half-way helpful.  After the instructions said to go to the port forwarding page on my router, no amount of clicking "next" would take me to the next set of instructions on their site.  I was however able to figure out the ports by googling on my own.  I was quite impressed with the DDNS set-up.  Easy to use once the router is configured.  set up of zviewer on Android was easy as well.I did have a learning curve trying to figure out which input device i wanted to use, mouse or remote.  I ended up using a combination of both, but would prefer to use the mouse.  The interface was a little hard to navigate until actually in a menu, then the mouse worked fine.I did end up with one glass lens cover cracked out of the box, but Zmodo RMA'd it really fast, and didn't even require a ship-back to them.  They have top notch customer service.Will probably buy again.

Reviews.Title: Security
Reviews.Author: carolyn Dunagan
Reviews.Content: Wow I am impressed. Everything you may need in a package. I had enough line for my cameras and it was easy to install. We made it a family afair. Everyone had fun putting this all together

Reviews.Title: 5 Stars Outstanding System
Reviews.Author: LSM
Reviews.Content: I have installed this system but it has 8 camera capacity and it is an outstanding systems. I am not buying a 4 camera systems.Would recommend to anyone for use in home or business. Very easy to install, and extremely easy to operate and maintain.

Reviews.Title: The easiest home diy survalance system ever
Reviews.Author: supermom
Reviews.Content: I have had this for 8 months and have it hooked to my tv in my living room. 3 out of the 4 camaras still have a great picture the 4th is foggy looking. They did great during the summer and now after all this cold cold weather and snow and ice in sw michigan they are still doing great. All 4 are mounted outside under my overhang in different locations. The cords are long enough to reach 3 of the 4 sides of my house. It is a great system and the whole thing once hooked up and fairly simple to operate and program.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Irish
Reviews.Content: Picture is clear - easy to set up.  Exactly what we needed to make our home safe from intruders.  Good price.

Reviews.Title: awsome
Reviews.Author: cranehed
Reviews.Content: i had the original crash and it was stilll under warrentythey sent the new version and service was awesomewould not have changed a thing

Reviews.Title: Good for what it does.
Reviews.Author: C. T. Lee
Reviews.Content: It's wired but we have drop ceilings in our office so it was relatively easy. Considering the wireless for my home.Initial Setup: relatively easy.Picture quality: good,Record quality: good,Playback quality: good,Internet setup: hard / difficult.I am a computer/it/networking specialist. And getting it through my various firewalls, and stuff was not easy. The built-in software on this model/version has issues. I've setup only a couple other types of security camera types but they lacked proper network security. This one, kind of goes the other way, I think.

Reviews.Title: This is a very good quality product, especially for the price.
Reviews.Author: Michael Armstrong
Reviews.Content: I have bought DVR camera systems in the past and I have never had come near to the quality of this system, especially for the price. The last one I bought cost me $1,000.00 and this one beats it by far. The cameras are upgraded in this package and the picture is true video, not pictures-per-second where the video is choppy and seems to be taking pictures really fast like my last system, no this one is true real-time camcorder quality footage. And the system is fairly easy to set up, (assuming you are able to access the attic or crawlspace if needed). The only downfall to this unit, and I would have thought they would have added this feature to all systems is WIFI, this system doesn't have it. You have to hard wire it to an ethernet cable, so plan on putting it close to your internet router if you are going to want to view the cameras online. You will also need to purchase a special cord that goes to your television, one that is the same as one that goes from a computer monitor to the computer. (It costs $20.00 at Radio Shack). The night vision is o.k., better than any other system I have had but you can still only make a persons face out at about 6 feet away and see the vague image of someone at about 25 feet.

Reviews.Title: This could be better.
Reviews.Author: Norman
Reviews.Content: I have a lot of IT experience and I struggled with this.  Overall the system is pretty good for the price.  The only issue I have had is with the network setup.  I tested port 80 before trying to use it and it was blocked by my ISP.  So I opted for port 85.  I am able to login remotely using IE.  I was not able to get this to work using any other Web Browser.  Even then you will need to change ActiveX controls for IE in Windows.  If you are using a MAC don't even try.  The only thing I am stuck on is remote viewing with a smart phone.  I have tried 3 different smart phones.  One is an iPhone and the other two are different Androids.  I will be calling the company tomorrow to see if they can resolve this.  I own an older WILIFE system from Logitech.  That still works great! Just no night vision.UPDATE.  OK, to get the DVR to talk to a smart phone you need to do an update of the unit.  You need to download a particular file and put it on an EMPTY flash drive.  Empty is the key word.  I powered down the unit and attached the flash drive.  Turned the DVR back on and the mouse did not respond.  The trick here is to unplug the USB mouse and plug it into another port.  I followed the instructions and loaded the file. I then told the unit to NOT reboot. You then set the unit to restore defaults.  It rebooted and resolved the issue.  You would think they would have had a way to have the unit go to the internet and download the file.  So the unit is working as designed.  I also liked their CHAT support.  The two times I used it the person on the other end was helpful.  I changed my rating from 3 to 4 stars.  You have to WOW me to get 5 stars.  No WOW factor here.

Reviews.Title: A very good purchase!
Reviews.Author: alisonfeldman
Reviews.Content: This system is great for the price. I have had it since March of 2013 and it still works great. We were having problems with some neighbors and had to have the sherriff out to watch the footage that we caught. Problems stopped right away, and he told us that we had a nice little set up. Our kids are old enough (and pool shallow enough) that we dont have to sit next to the pool when they are in it, nevertheless we aimed a camera directly at it and we can keep our eye on them from the comfort of our air conditioned livingroom. Now that we moved back into town we spoke to an officer to make sure we were within our rights for the locations of the cameras and we are fine. This system doesnt see very well/far at night. Set up a light near it and that problem is solved. On the side of our shop where we park cars we have installed a motion sensor porch light and now if anything moves we can clearly see what is going on in the video. I wish it had come with Audio, but you get what you pay for, and I am more than satisfied with my purchase. I would recommend this product to friends and family. I may upgrade to an 8 channel system in the future, but for now this suits my needs.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo purchase and installation
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this sytem for my business last week.  It took me about 2 hours to install.  I loved the fact that it was plug and play.  The video quality for the price is a great deal.  All of my cameras were installed indoors and allow me to see with good clarity, the work taking place.  I did require customer support when getting the system set up online, but that was because I am not a networking guruh!  It took about 30 minutes of wait time before I was able to talk to someone but only about 10 minutes of remote assistance before I was able to view my system online from anywhere!  I am very pleased with the system thus far and would recommend it to others who would be using it for similar applications.

Reviews.Title: nice system for the price
Reviews.Author: tyrone a smith
Reviews.Content: I really like the system it was easy to install the video was very clear I did have a little problem programming the dvr

Reviews.Title: Night vision
Reviews.Author: Zaundra Brown
Reviews.Content: Night vision is not the best., if you don't have lights around your house before you install this system .

Reviews.Title: Almost useless video quality
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "mfb@iki.fi"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Cheap. Easy to install, complete setup, the cameras look real enough, cameras and mounting parts seem reasonably solid, IR-illumination, lots of functions (most of which I haven't bothered to try, because of the...)Cons: Lousy picture quality! Even in daylight. The burglar has to look directly into the camera, from a couple of yards at most, in order to be identifiable. The surveillance video recordings look like they were from the 80's... And yes, I double checked that I had used the highest video and recording settings, but it sure doesn't look like that.In addition, the main unit froze one of the perhpas dozen times I operated it, but this really doesn't matter much.Conclusion. Not worth even the modest price nor the effort to install. The video recordings are probably better than nothing, but if serious about security, I'd suggest paying for a much higher quality system. Or, if not, paying even less and getting dummy cameras instead.

Reviews.Title: Good Starter System
Reviews.Author: JBP
Reviews.Content: The DVR itself is good. It seems to work well but the software interface looks a bit dated. I Would have rated the system higher if it wasn't for the cameras that come with the system. They work okay if you only need them in daylight or well lighted area and don't need a wide field view. I would highly recommend just buying the DVR by itself and getting better cameras. These are the ones I ordered and have been happy with them so far day and night.VideoSecu Surveillance Outdoor Security Infrared

Reviews.Title: great deal for the price!
Reviews.Author: brinkley
Reviews.Content: I bought this item after wasting money on a wireless camera elsewhere, To much interference.The price is great, setup was simple, although networking is difficult unless you are an I.T. expert.I called tech support and waited 45 minutes on hold but when the english speaking american ladyanswered she had me networked in minutes, tv, laptop and iphone.I read negative reviews about this product but for the price it's wonderful.Facial recognition at night is difficult but daytime use is great with color.

Reviews.Title: Zmodo
Reviews.Author: Amy Daigle
Reviews.Content: Set up is hard to do. Directions are inadequate and calling into the customer support line is a joke. I actually got someone through the online chat on a Sunday. It still isn't completely set up, trying to figure how to connect to it online. I would have Second thoughts about buying this product. As far as the picture quality goes, that's not bad for the cost. But no matter what, expect to spend a lot of time working with it. I am not very happy with this unit.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Darlene
Reviews.Content: I originally made this purchase because I was trying to update our existing system, and because of the great price. But when we connected the cameras, the picture quality was quite poor - very grainy. I ultimately sent the system back and purchased replacement cameras with much better picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Took us over 4 hours to just get the basics to work
Reviews.Author: wewa
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not for the faint of technical heart. I am a 25+ year technical professional.My friend ordered it on amazon and received it, and could not figure out all the security mumbo jumbo, mixed in with a lot of networking and internet IP terminology.And the setup poster was printed in 4 point font so that was real fun too.We finally got 1 camera to show up on our Vizio LCD HDTV, which we are using as our display (since this kit has no display included) and we were able to connect it with the composite cable, instead of finding/buying a expensive VGA (RGB) video cable like the install poster shows.Noticed that the mouse arrow cursor would drift around on the screen, so that you would have to constantly fight putting it back where you need to.Setup to DHCP and rebooted the DVR, and set the ports in the Belkin router and then was able to ping locally 192 range IP and then the public IP. It seems to not support Google Chrome browser. Other reviews say that it only will work with IE, no Firefox either. :(No mention of any smartphone app in the documentation, but luckily in the product reviews here, you can find one. We got it to work on a galaxy 2, after about an hour of scanning for ports that the app does on setup. :(I had purchased the samsung wifi camera (SNH-1011N - 2 cameras $180) kit, which is about double the cost, with no dvr, but you can save videos to your youtube account. This too, can be a pain to setup initially, but after figuring it out, I bought 2 more so I have 4 of them on my wifi now.[...]So we're comparing the Zmodo wired with the Samsung wifi ones.Will update review if we end up keeping it.

Reviews.Title: Product is Good -Support is hard to get
Reviews.Author: Gerald L Davis
Reviews.Content: I received and installed this product. Setup was fairly simple except for web access to DVR. I have been trying for 2 days to get a hold of tech support this problem. So far I have been on hold twice for 25 minutes even for remote support. So far I have not been able to talk to anyone. Hurray! Tech support called me back and assisted me with the web problem. Tech support was very professional and polite once they contacted me.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Janet A. Akers
Reviews.Content: I rodered this system for one of my brothers for security of his home and it has worked so well that recently I ordered another system for another of my brothers and he is just as impressed with it as my other brother.  The cameras work well and have great pictures and are easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Good Low cost cameras
Reviews.Author: JRud
Reviews.Content: This is a decent system overall. After tweaking DVR settings cameras had a pretty good daytime picture, however cameras are just about worthless at night. The easy fix too that is a motion activated spot light. DVR is easy to setup, easy to use, and so far very reliable. The internet connectivity is almost impossible to setup. 1 camera died within30 days and tech support was quick at sending a replacement. Considering cost this system is well worth the $, with the money saved a spotlight, or different cameras would be a useful upgrade. I would not hesitate purchasing again.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price but takes time to setup
Reviews.Author: A. Marolla "Tico"
Reviews.Content: Being honest, this is a great product for any tech savvy person.  However, the key phrase here is "tech savvy" because if you do not know much about Dynamic DNS or your own static IP address at your home, you will have a challenge for setting up the web interfacing.  I set this up to be accessible with my iPhone and it works great.  The motion detection works awesome and the system will email you with quick picture of the motion detection.  Also if you research with your cellular company, you can also have the email sent to you as a text message.  For instance, I have Att and their email to text format is: mobile#@txt.att.net for plain texting or you can get the picture and text as well with mobile#@mms.att.net.  The only downside to this was that it was text via a different number each time.  It would have been good if it was the same number so I could set a distinct tone for it.  My best advice, if you do not know anything in regards to IP setup and configuring a network, your best bet is to get someone who does.  Other than that, this is a great system and the picture is clear.  The night vision works great and the install is easy.  It will work out of the box, but to get outside connectivity, it needs to be configured!

Reviews.Title: recommended

Reviews.Title: Good system/has no wireless capability
Reviews.Author: Richard S. Desiderio
Reviews.Content: Easy to install, I needed 2 60' extensions for $11.99 each, and a trip to Radio shack for 2 BNC Couplings for $3.50 each to get the job done.  The system works well.  I had a vandalism problem (2 Michelins stabbed in the sidewall) and this system with a warning sign on the front of the building seems to have done the trick, problem solved.  No one wants to have the shame of being caught on camera.  After I was up and running I called the Zmodo # (866) 903-5674 to set up remote viewing from my iPad and iPhone.  You can use a laptop but Internet Explorer is the only browser that is compatable.  I had read in various places that the DVR must be hooked up with a ethernet cable directly to the router to set up remote viewing, but it didn't register in my head that it had to stay that way to continue working.  So the DVR has no wireless capability.  Now i had to relocate my modem/wireless router from my office area to the bedroom where the DVR resides.  I spent ony 44 minutes on the phone (hold time included) getting everything set up, although some reviewers spent up to 2 hours. I'm on the East coast and the tech line opens at 9 am my time, so i called at 9:01 and got right through.Ok, so now im done and everything works great and I am very happy with my purchase.  Zmodo has a free  app called Zviewer designed to work with their products and I must say Bravo, it really works well (real time viewing only from the iPhone/ iPad).PS-Plan on drilling a 1" hole through the side of your home to feed the wires through, you might get away with 3/4" but your going to regret not drilling the 1" hole to begin with.

I am not sure. ...  Overall, if you're thinking about a camera system, this one seems pretty good!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for. Not exceptional but it works great for me.
Reviews.Author: Matt Sarnocinski
Reviews.Content: So out of the box this system looks great. Comes well packaged both inside and out. Cameras are individually packaged in foam sleeves and individually boxed. The receiver unit comes in its own box and is packaged in a liberal amount of bubble material. The remote control, instruction manual & I assume instructional mini-DVD are all in a bag with the receiver.The wires for the cameras are by no means top of the line but as long as you're careful, you'll be fine. I read a LOT of reviews about people having issues with stapling the wires to the walls, but I have 3 out of 4 cameras mounted and no issues with the staples. The camera bases aren't the best, they take some finagling to get right, but they work well enough that you shouldn't have to worry about the camera flopping around like a wet noodle.I purchased the advanced (24 IR LED) kit and I am impressed with the cameras ability to illuminate at night; no football stadium lighting here but good enough to cover my entire back patio and even can see the light on the ground from my 2nd floor mounted camera aimed at my cars. Image quality on screen is par, but playback quality is much less, people are discernable but don't expect this to be full HD like the movies. Night time image quality is what you should expect from a $200 camera system.The equipment is simple to install, easy to use, and while the manual has some broken english it is legible to anybody who understands english. So far I've only had one HDD error which was resolved by powering down the unit and powering back up. I've been constantly recording for 3 days now with zero issues.I highly recommend this product over the $600 Lorex system if you need something quick and simple. However, not having wireless cameras is a pain in the ass as I have had to tuck 60 feet of wiring under my baseboards and what not. Aside from that though, this system does everything I could want it to do. But if you live in anything bigger than an apartment, go ahead and buy longer cables for the cameras. My 800 sq ft townhouse is too big for one of the sets of wires to reach from upstairs to the receiver.Also the receiver pictured is not what I received. Mine is much sleeker with no buttons and only 2 red LEDs on the front indicating power and HDD recording. I would have to say that since some of the other reviews there has been a large number of improvements to this system. But if you're looking for high quality images and HD playback, go with a better system. If you just need an added sense of security around your property and have a tight budget like me, you cannot go wrong with the Zmodo!

The only things that I consider to be a drawback are that it seems to record all the time, not just when it's tripped by motion sensing. The other thing is that I'd like is to have more control from the iphone app, like being able to see the videos that've been recorded not just live.Compared to other products, I think it's a steal, I was surprised that the HDD was a Western Digital and not some off brand. Reviews.Content: Right out of the box this system works well without much hassle.  You will need to set everything out to make sure you have what you need in the way screwdrivers, drills and such.The cameras are good quality but not super distance cameras.  Paired with the DVR for the price you can't go wrong with the system.  You can swap out cameras if you want a higher res or more detailed oriented camera, just remember you are purchasing a lower priced system under $400.00 here.  These are good basic cameras.I suggest using Coax video cables to get a better image quality out of the system.  The included wiring is a bit on the cheap side and not really worth the time and effort needed for installation.  Make sure you reread the installation guide and look over the parts as you set up the system because it looks like a 3rd grade Chinese interpreter wrote the manual.  Poor grammar and all sorts of odd guideline sentences.  Had to reread many sections a few times to really understand the steps involved.Call US Support for issues.  I believe from other reviews the chat and email is sent to China which just exacerbates the issues you may have if they develop.  When you go to setup the DVR make sure you have a non Mac system for install, it's not Mac compatible but they have an app that you can use on your iphone for remote viewing.  Use your PC monitor for viewing.Overall good system for the money and one that is a great bare bones basic system.

Reviews.Title: Great System Easy Install
Reviews.Author: Nathan S. "N8R"
Reviews.Content: We had a power outage and the surge protector did not protect my old security system.  It blew out the DVR and my security system was down.  I called a repair person and he quoted me $415.00 for a new 4 channel DVR and 1 dome camera.  I told him to hold off and I went on Amazon and checked for the least expensive system and found this one.  I own a small business and like most money is tight.  I paid around $195.00 delivered and it was here with standard shipping in about 3 days (that is awesome in itself).  Once the system came in I had a tech savvy friend drop by and he installed the new camera and the DVR in about 45 minutes.  It works perfectly and the resolution on the new cameras is better than the old system (3 years old) by far.  I was warned by the first technician that I called not to buy "cheap" stuff but I rolled the dice knowing that Amazon has always treated me good with their refund policies (there was a 30 day refund policy on this particular item).  In addition, I love the mouse that came with the system because I can zoom in on one camera with the click of the mouse or click again and see all four.  If you own a small business and you are looking for an inexpensive way to keep an eye on things this is definitely the way to go.  Since I already have a monitor that did not get damaged the day of the power outage I have not hooked it up to my iPhone yet but the instructions are simple so when I find time I will do that.  This is one of the best values I have ever purchased in business, literally.  I am a legit businessman and this review is based on facts.  You may visit my website at [...] thanks...Nate

Reviews.Author: E. Paul
Reviews.Content: Online web chat, 800 number and remote support - all very nice, but not worth a dime if none work or no one picks up the phone!  Spend a slight bit more for a easier to use system that has a modicum of support and you will be better off.

Reviews.Title: Great product for price!!
Reviews.Author: Squirrelhead
Reviews.Content: This product was easy to get setup, and connect, and it works great.  I don't understand the negative reviews about how hard it is to use and setup.  The instruction manual is pretty self explanatory.  I didn't even use the user manual until I needed to find out the default admin password, then i skimmed  over it to make sure I hadn't missed anything.I was very happy with the resolution and the IR (night vision) capability.  There have been several people complaining because you can't see something far away in the dark ...well don't put your camera so far away.  The camera can only pick up what can be seen by the infrared light and an infrared led can only "shine" so far.  Even an expensive camera isn't going to see in the dark with IR light.  I'm able to see the distance across my house and that is good enough for me. If you need more light you can buy another IR light for the area.If you are looking for a good surveillance system and a great price then I highly recommend this.

I did and the seller told me they couldn't help me for it was Amazon that filled the order. I was getting the run around for sure. Back at Amazon and the person told me they would give me a refund for the cable which they did. I still had to buy a new cable for this system to work like its made to work.  This run around shouldn't have happened at all. It was Zmodo's system and they should have taken care of it the first time. I received my new cable and its up and running and Amazons refund for the cable is in my account. I just wonder how the warranty and service will work, (a run around before something is fixed) Zmodo has a Customer Support phone number but will not help if you didn't get the system from them in the fist place. Not a happy camper here at all. But Happy at the way Amazon handled this for me after the run around I was getting. This shouldn't happen. Next time I will check more into the company that is selling the items I'm looking to buy and ask questions.
